page.title: 15Nomansland Nature Trail
page.content: The Nature trail is managed by the Hertfordshire and Middlesex Trust for Nature Conservation. The common was used as grazing land for 3000 years but it was stopped in the 1950s. At the same time myxomatosis killed off many rabbits. This affected the plants because sheep and rabbits used to eat the little seedlings so not too many trees would grow but now trees have grown up so most of them are 20/30 years old. The ground cover is acid heathland it is one of the few remaining habitats of its kind in Hertfordshire. Typical heathland plants that grow on the common are common gorze, heather, furze and petty whin which is very rare.Trees which have grown up are hawthorn, sycamore, silverbirch, aspen and hazel. Nettles and silverweed grow where the land has been disturbed.
